intro: Fumana glutinosa f. barrelieri, commonly known as the sticky fumana, is a unique variant of the fumana plant characterized by its sticky secretions on its leaves and stems. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is native to specific regions in Africa. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its specialized morphology. Its sticky properties may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores or to trap moisture in dry climates. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its distinct features and ecological adaptations.
